website_summaries.verdict: Kirby’s Nintendo Switch debut is even better alongside your own friends playing as classic allies from previous games such as Adeleine & Ribbon, Kine, and Taranza.
pros: Turn Kirby’s enemies into new pals

customer_reviews.title: it’s terrific, no it’s wonderfully-incredible”
customer_reviews.text: This was on my son’s Easter list. He is 11 with special needs. He’s a man of very few words. He said, it’s terrific, no it’s wonderfully-incredible. Great graphics and it’s so much fun”. I think that means he gives it 5 stars! He got this kirby game, scribblenauts showdown and pikachu detective in his easter basket, this is by far his favorite of the 3!! Scribblenauts is a close runner up.
customer_reviews.author: IneedAmazonRehab

customer_reviews.title: Game box hasn’t no game inside!
customer_reviews.text: My game came empty. No game inside. No manual. Just the box. Didn’t think to open it right aaay, was a gift for my son. He opened it, on his birthday, and it was empty. The one game he asked for. And of course, things always seem to happen like that. Never had a problem with anything from amazon before.
customer_reviews.author: Loveamazon

customer_reviews.title: Great game to play with friends and family
customer_reviews.text: Great game to play with friends and family. The game isn’t all that hard, but has a lot of fun abilities to team up with. Playing it with my 8 year old daughter. she’s had some trouble, but nothing major at all. If you want some nice relaxing local multiplayer with pleasing graphics and good gameplay then I’d suggest picking this up
customer_reviews.author: goodels89

customer_reviews.title: This game is good so far but it is too easy.
customer_reviews.text: I have played the game for about an hour and I can say that it is pretty fun. The game looks great and local co-op is an added bonus. My only problem with this game so far is that it is a bit too easy. I understand that I am not the targeted demographic for this game hence why I am not knocking it down but I do have to mention it. This game will be great for younger gamers.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: EMPTY CASE!!
customer_reviews.text: I just received the game EMPTY I CANT BELIEVE YOU PLAY WITH KIDS FEELING LIKE THIS
customer_reviews.author: Lisbeth

customer_reviews.title: Cute & fun multiplayer!
customer_reviews.text: Super fun to play with a friend! I’ve never played a Kirby game before, but I wanted a new Switch game to play so it’s not just sitting there collecting dust. It’s definitely no BOTW or Odyssey, but it’s a good holdover game until the bigger titles release. It’s very simple, very cute, and great for some relaxing, mindless gameplay. If you took advantage of Amazon’s preorder price, I think you got a good enough deal for this title. If not, then maybe play the demo first?
customer_reviews.author: Charles Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Fun Kirby game that's not too deep but dynamic and challenging at times
customer_reviews.text: I've played Kirby from back on the GameBoy so this game feels great, fun, colorful and the different power ups and costumes and environments keep play fun. But I miss the hammer smash to crack the planet from the SNES days! They do have a rocket/smash asteroid game in place of it though. Great fun for kids and adults too! -Rick, Techspin Review, Youtube
customer_reviews.author: Techspin

customer_reviews.title: Its okay.
customer_reviews.text: The game is very simple but playing as Kirby isn't as fun as playing another character. If you beat the game you can play through it again as a character of your choosing. There are at least four main characters on the screen at once and it is easy to lose yourself in the confusion. The story is a good length and the replay value is moderate. I do not believe this game was worth full price. Pros - Simple, better the second time, couch co-op, forgiving Cons - Kirby is the least fun to play, can lose yourself among the many characters on screen, not worth full price
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a grandson
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this five stars, despite not having a clue as to what the Kirby Star Alliance is— I don’t even know if the “star” in question is astronomy based or Hollywood based (the character on the label looks like some sort of pink amoeba, which could be either, or neither). All I know is that it was very high on my grandson’s wish list, that he was absolutely thrilled to receive it, and that it resulted in his ignoring the real world for hours, fascinated by the game. And that was good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Portista

customer_reviews.title: Overeasy even for a Kirby game
customer_reviews.text: Every secret item and area is obtainable in the first playthrough of a level without thinking ahead or looking it up. Right before any secret entrance or requirements to get through things there is always out of place enemies that will give you the powers needed to open or find the secret. That being said, the mixing of powers is niche but the fun factor wears off quickly once you've seen them all (approx 3-5 hours of play)
customer_reviews.author: Calyx Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Really Boring
customer_reviews.text: This is really more of a kid's game. I'm more of a moderate gamer, myself, and don't often scoff at the more cartoon-y games, but this really left a lot to be desired. There is next-to-no story, and the gameplay itself is tedious and redundant. The characters can be pretty cute, though, and if this is a game for a child, it's among the most family-friendly you'll find.
customer_reviews.author: Juvi Guevara

customer_reviews.title: Good game, could have been better.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game but it could do better in almost every department. It controls just a little sluggish to a point that it feels slow. The framerates being 30 doesn't help that, it is somewhat noticable. On top of that the base game wasn't the full game and even though content got added it isn't enough to incentivize going back and trying out the admittedly minor changes. However purchasing it now you get a decent kirby game, try getting it on sale though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FUN
customer_reviews.text: I am new to video games. Yes, I am an adult (almost 30) and I am new to video games. I do not play often but I do enjoy the occasional game. This game is fun! It is good for someone like me who is new to video games and it really bad at all of them. This games gives me a nice fun distraction while giving me enough time to learn how to video game properly! Also, great for kids... Old and young!
customer_reviews.author: someone interesting

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Easy, Tons Of Fun
customer_reviews.text: As is typical with the Kirby franchise, the game was stupidly easy, but I had a blast playing it. Very very fun game with solid replay value that I'm sure will have me coming back and playing it quite often. There's so many amazing games out for the Switch already, but I still definitely recommend to pick this up.
customer_reviews.author: Boom

customer_reviews.title: Family friendly fun suitable for young kids
customer_reviews.text: Great game with simple gameplay you can pick up and play with young kids. Controls are simple and difficulty is very forgiving but older players will find more nuances in available move sets, puzzles, and challenges. My 5 year old gets excited to play together and thinks the game is great fun, between the CPU helpers and myself we're able to keep the game going at a nice pace and she has fun doing what she can and is comfortable with. Great art style, animation, and gameplay that brings the best of simple platformers to new generations.
customer_reviews.author: BuyItOnce

customer_reviews.title: Charming as ever and great if you are looking for a cooperative experience
customer_reviews.text: Charming as ever and great if you are looking for a cooperative experience. The bad thing is the innovation and level of challenge, but if you love Kirby everything should be fine
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best titles in the Switch's library
customer_reviews.text: The latest in a series of stellar, innovative takes on Nintendo IPs for the Switch. Co-op could not possibly be easier, with additional players able to instantly drop in or out at any point. The powers are all expanded and very fun to experiment with, and the combination of abilities is both fresh and a bit nostalgic of a similar mechanic in the N64 "Crystal Chronicles" title. Thicc King Dedede 11/10
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Richards

customer_reviews.title: Watch out
customer_reviews.text: I got an European version of the game but never got any warning about it.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: It looks amazing and the game play is very smooth
customer_reviews.text: So I have been a fan of Kirby ever since I first played the series on my GameBoy Advance years ago. So needless to say I was excited to purchase this game. It looks amazing and the game play is very smooth. Only reason I gave it four stars is because the main levels are a little easy especially since they give you lots of health items and you can easily get a lot of one ups. Otherwise it’s a great entry to the series.
customer_reviews.author: Kydo26

customer_reviews.title: K I R B Y
customer_reviews.text: It is a very fun game, a bit short as others have mentioned. The multi player is great though. That is the main reason I couldn't stand Splatoon, no split screen, what's the point? The visuals are great, the move sets for the characters are surprisingly deep. I can used the D-pad OR the analog stick, which is nice they enabled that. I've found that the joy-cons in the grip are really good for games like this. The pro contrller's buttons have some give, the joy-cons have a satisfying click to them, even if it is not a proper d-pad.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but still tough for non gamers to get into
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother to play when his Girlfriend. She's not very good at games but this was supposed to be extremely easy to get into. But sadly she still couldn't figure out the controls and said it was confusing. Also the game is really short for $60. I enjoyed it but you really need 4 players who are least played some games in the past and know how to use a controller.
customer_reviews.author: Rndy The Misbehave

customer_reviews.title: Mostly worth it
customer_reviews.text: While many would say that the content is a little on the slim side ( I do wise the game had more to offer) it is a great 4 player Kirby experience with the most unique abilities seen in the franchise thus far. The bonus, free DLC characters are a joy to experiment with. Mostly good for 5 - 10 year olds, or long fans of the Kirby series.
customer_reviews.author: David Wendel

customer_reviews.title: a waste
customer_reviews.text: I bought the game hoping more than one person could play for a family activity. It seems that the only thing that you do as a second and third player is follow the first player. Very disappointed. I wish I could return it. Worst 60 dollars I have ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: Seven Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Gorgerous, if short, game that offers plenty of fun
customer_reviews.text: It's beautiful and tons of fun, especially with my spouse. However, the game was delivered on Friday and we had finished it after playing casually Sunday afternoon so it's not exactly a long game. It's relatively easy but that is okay with us, too many games get super hard and then my wife can no longer enjoy them. Overall, we had fun.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great new game.
customer_reviews.text: Received this unbelievably fast and my kids LOVE, LOVE this game. AWESOME! I love the fact that you download it and don't have to worry about losing the game...it's downloaded. All of them should be this way. I am so tired of the kids misplacing the games. They are too expensive to lose!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Darstein

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Wasted potential.
customer_reviews.text: I just don't get it. This game seems like we're stuck in a tutorial and never really allowed to go out and experiment with mixing all the different character powers. Nothing seems to matter and you can clear any course with any combination. Good game in theory but a failure in execution.
customer_reviews.author: J.R. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: You can stand still and defeat most of the bosses
customer_reviews.author: blueyami87

customer_reviews.title: Not As Good As I Expected
customer_reviews.text: This game was very ok. I enjoyed the gameplay overall, however it was way too easy and way too short. The entire game can be beaten in about 10 hours and probably 100% in about 15 hours. The levels were creative and fun, but the puzzles all had the answers spelled out to you. This isn't as good as the previous entries, but it's ok. Get it at $30 or less.
customer_reviews.author: Mickle

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful cute graphics that make a sudden turn to awesome and epic.  Worth having.
customer_reviews.text: I fell in love with this game the moment I started playing. The graphics are beautiful, the cuteness doesn't divert from the fact that this game can get quite epic, and although it only has four worlds, it has plenty of content to make you feel good about your purchase of this game. Not just that, but there is even more content coming soon, which promises to add more to do in this fun game. Play it Loud!
customer_reviews.author: Willie G.R.Top Contributor: Amiibo

customer_reviews.title: Fun for everyone
customer_reviews.text: This game is a fantastic co-op experience, especially with kids. You can play by yourself or play up to 4 player co-op, and it's a blast. This game is not designed for hardcore gamers looking for a challenge - it's just FUN. Anyone can get into it, even those people that have never played games before, and have a good time. It's cute, it's charming, and it's very well designed. It can be played in short spurts and mixing and matching Kirby's powers to overcome obstacles is just a blast.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Great for any age, especially with young kids
customer_reviews.text: I love the game!! The graphic is amazing and the frame rate is great. The gameplay is fun especially playing with my 5-year-old son. Since the game levels are not timed we can spend as much time as we need to complete each levels, great when my son is trying to figure out things or explore. Well worth the price and really brought my family together.
customer_reviews.author: B. Chiu

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-player game!!
customer_reviews.text: My kids enjoy playing this and it's a great game for up to 4 players. We have two joycons and we are able to split them up and use them for 4 players. It's a teamwork type game, which I really encourage with my kids...I like that better than them versing each other!
customer_reviews.author: Mommy Dealest

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: I love the visuals on this game, it just looks beautiful on the tv, definitely recommend playing in dock mode, the game is also great in hand held mode, it is also really fun to play with someone else, you will love it if you like kirby games.
customer_reviews.author: Julio C

customer_reviews.title: I generally like Kirby games
customer_reviews.text: I generally like Kirby games. This one has a good concept, but I cannot change the controls like I want to. The fact that the jump button is opposite what mario games usually use throws me for a loop every time. I wish there was an option to change the individual buttons. For me this is such a deal breaker, but the game is overall decent.
customer_reviews.author: Wadev3

customer_reviews.title: Great game, but too short!
customer_reviews.text: Great game, but too short! I beat it in under 6 hours, which is unacceptable for a $60 game. I hold Nintendo to a much higher standard than this.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas L.

customer_reviews.title: Good game, but wait until price goes down
customer_reviews.text: Not the best iteration of Kirby, but still fun. Some of the character's abilities are not that great and it's easy to lose your character in the mass of characters on the screen sometimes. I'd wait until the game was cheaper before I buy it though.
customer_reviews.author: jman236

customer_reviews.title: Fun but easy. Classic Kirby style with a twist.
customer_reviews.text: Fun classic Kirby style game with a twist. I have enjoyed the first several hours playing. I do find it rather easy so if you are looking for a more challenging game this may not be the one.
customer_reviews.author: Chris ilo

customer_reviews.title: Truly multi player game
customer_reviews.text: My family has noticed since getting the switch how difficult it is to find a multi player game for all of us to play together. This is finally a truly multi player game for the whole family. All 3 of my kids and myself can pick up a controller each and play together, IN THE SAME ROOM. It's simple enough for my 3 year old to play, and fun enough to keep the attention of my 11 year old.
customer_reviews.author: rei_lt

customer_reviews.title: Great for young kids
customer_reviews.text: Our boys (6,8,10) like the Kirby series and really enjoyed this game. It didn't take them very long to 'conquer' it, but they keep going back to it to try other accomplishments. They like the additional special abilities for the characters.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. T Zen

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to the Nintendo Switch
customer_reviews.text: Fun game, good mechanics, really vibrant visuals. The control layout takes some time to get used to and the game feels a little short. Overall, a fun game.
customer_reviews.author: Brosidon of the Brocian

customer_reviews.title: I love kirby, but this was mediocre
customer_reviews.text: I love kirby, and this has really great graphics. I bought it on release date and it just was not as great as I had expected it to be. It seems that nintendo didn't really put much effort in making the game more enjoyable or making the adventure more 2018 worthy.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: More fun as a multi-player then a single player game.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game. My husband and kids (10 and 7 years old) really enjoy it. We had the fabric Wii game version and really love that. It is a little sad that they left behind the fabric look. This version seems to be a less beautiful Mario look. Having said that the graphics are still pretty fun and as a multi-player game it is great. When it is played with a single player it almost helps you too much.
customer_reviews.author: TechGalt

customer_reviews.title: Great Game.
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a fun game, didn't think it was going to be this fun to play.
customer_reviews.author: Eazi Dollaz

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: This product sucked! It was a sticker on a piece of plastic. Not a game at all. I sent it back and got a refund.

customer_reviews.title: great multiplayer game for families
customer_reviews.text: easy game, great for young children just getting into video games, or for traditional non gamers. go watch reviews o youtube, it's a very fun relaxing non-demanding game
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Two Shoes

customer_reviews.title: Great With Friends!
customer_reviews.text: I have not played my copy as of yet but it was very fun when I played it at a friends house with multiple people. It arrived sooner than expected and in perfect condition. Prime giving 20% off is just an added bonus so I would recommend grabbing it while that discount is in effect!!
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Kirby Game for the Switch
customer_reviews.text: My son likes Kirby and he lost the one he got in Christmas. He does not stop talking about the game and how he is missing out on the new added characters/stages in the games. I caved in and spent the money for this game again. My fault for introducing Kirby to him which started in the Nintendo DS, DSi, 3DS, then Wii, the Wii U, then now the Switch.
customer_reviews.author: JesTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good classic fun for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that it may feel repetitive or have a lackluster plot, but I was genuinely engaged and I am in love with this game; let alone, in love with the fanchise. Despite its cute appearance, it can have tricky stages and battles and it’s fun for any age! I recommend this on must haves for the Nintendo switch.
customer_reviews.author: Ames Ortiaco

customer_reviews.title: Great game.
customer_reviews.text: Having so much fun. But I would have a lot more fun if the camera followed players 2-4 as well. But other than that, the game is great!
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Needed ramped difficulty and worse AI
customer_reviews.text: The game was overly simplistic and repetitive, the AI that could be replaced by human players was too good which resulted into the “puzzles” being solved for you. I understand Kirby has been historically easy but 3 hours in I had over 100 lives and had not died and felt like I was just running from point A to B. Stick to donkey Kong if you want something with a bit more depth.
customer_reviews.author: JValenti0330

customer_reviews.title: Family friendly and entertaining
customer_reviews.text: A family friendly game that isn't very challenging, yet entertaining enough to keep you playing to completion. The graphics are very good and extremely colorful.
customer_reviews.author: Mord13th

customer_reviews.title: It's alright...
customer_reviews.text: It's really not that bad. I just don't think the game is worth $60. Main story was probably ~5 hours and I felt like I never would've played it again. I'm not a fan of the 4 companions either. It makes the game feel way too easy and crowds the screen like crazy. A lot of times I found myself ditching allies just so the game would seem more fun. There are just much better Kirby games out there. I'd rather replay almost any Kirby game before playing this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grandson enjoy's it
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday present for my grandson, the best thing that I can say it that every time I go over his house, he is playing the game.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Fun but not enough content
customer_reviews.text: I like Kirby because it is just so cute. Other than single-player mode, This is also good for the party, really fun to play. What can be done better: More content. CPU players are too strong.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful and fun update to the series
customer_reviews.text: A beautiful and fun update to the series. It is not a very long game, but I don't think anyone plays Kirby expecting it to be extremely long or difficult. Boss replays are fun. Turn up your gameplay a notch by doing the replay. It's great!
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: I may return when I get bored some day but not much here to really draw ...
customer_reviews.text: Average game. I've played it for maybe an hour or two and haven't gone back since. I may return when I get bored some day but not much here to really draw a normal gamer in.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher V. Gordy

customer_reviews.title: A decent entry
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad Kirby game but doesn't live up to the series' history. It looks beautiful and the gameplay is as fun as ever. If you want something co-op this will work great for you. However, it has a really small amount of content for an HD console game, especially when compared to the vast amount of things to do in the 3DS titles. The free DLC may fix this so if you want it I'd say wait until the fall when it's all been released.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy Gaming 🎮
customer_reviews.text: Ohhhhh how I would like the price to go down down down but I already know how Nintendo is - SMH 🤦🏾‍♂️ so I purchased it anyway!!! 😽😻😸 The game is fun. Another win for Nintendo 🏆🏅🎖. At some point, you should add it to your N. Switch library of games. Play the game with someone to make the most of it.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Scorpio

customer_reviews.title: Short and Sweet
customer_reviews.text: Growing up with Kirby I enjoy many installments Nintendo to the franchise and when they release a Kirby title as a platformer then all is good! However this installment is a lot shorter than other Kirby titles. Visually appealing, smooth controls, and the end game content is really good but the story mode is extremely short. With the output quality of both Zelda BoTW and Mario Odyssey had delivered I had high expectations along with them. Still a fun game just wish there was a lot more. Wait for the game to go on sale, not worth the full retailed price.
customer_reviews.author: Carli

customer_reviews.title: Simple Straightforward Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Kirby games aren't usually known for being the most challenging (or the most of anything considered "hardcore"), but what it does have it does very well, this includes: good level design, good mechanics, a large assortment of stages and content, different modes of play, 4 player local co-op, etc. This is where Kirby games really shine, and for the first game on the Nintendo Switch in the series, its worth it to pick up and play when you get the chance.
customer_reviews.author: N.S.

customer_reviews.title: I returned this game. Had about 5 people over ...
customer_reviews.text: I returned this game. Had about 5 people over to play 1-2-Switch and checked this out as well. Literally all 5 of my friends agreed with me after about 2 hours that it was not something we'd want to play again, ymmv...
customer_reviews.author: C. B. Edison

customer_reviews.title: It is Kirby and it looks and plays great.
customer_reviews.text: Fun game and my kids enjoyed it but I think the target audience might be younger then my children (12 to 16). They just found there to be little to challenge them and too quick to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Grant Jr

customer_reviews.title: Kirby?!?
customer_reviews.text: How can you go wrong with a Kirby game? This is not the vacuum cleaner Kirby, but the ever so fierce pink ball Kirby.
customer_reviews.author: Dabberoni

customer_reviews.title: The whole mood of the game experience is designed as if HAL wanted to make the player as happy as possible
customer_reviews.text: It's such a cute game! You really can't go wrong with Kirby. The whole mood of the game experience is designed as if HAL wanted to make the player as happy as possible, from the gameplay to the art style to the music. As with most Kirby games it's pretty easy, so if you're looking for a challenging platformer this definitely isn't one, but even hardcore gamers need something cute now & then.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Porter

customer_reviews.title: Great casual co-op experience
customer_reviews.text: This game really shines when you actually play couch co-op with it. Me and my girlfriend had so much fun playing this game, I would recommend this for anyone who actually has friends or someone else to play this with them.

customer_reviews.title: Too basic
customer_reviews.text: I sold this within the week of purchasing it. It was fun, but a very basic game. It would be a great game for younger children to play, especially those with little experience who are trying to strengthen their skills.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Great Game, But Too Easy
customer_reviews.text: This game is great in every way, except it is unplayably easy. Half the time it feels like the friends are playing it for you. I hope that a hard mode or a friendless made is added in an update.
customer_reviews.author: Cypig

customer_reviews.title: Classic Kirby but with tons of new gameplay dynamics and fun
customer_reviews.text: Great fun way to get through a Kirby game. The team aspect makes for fun and strategy at the same time. The bonus modes and the unlockables make for great fun. The most loaded and complete while still having that classic Kirby style game yet.

customer_reviews.title: Our son LOVED this game- only downside is it easily and quickly ...

customer_reviews.title: Really short. Really easy.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, not good. Story is dull and bosses are forgettable. Game is way to easy with or without allies. Side games aren't that interesting. Get game on sale or just play Kirby 64 or Robobot.

customer_reviews.title: Great game for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic game! Brings back the old school Kirby feel to the switch. Easy to play. Great game for all ages. Nothing too hard. If you like the Lego games, you’ll love the Kirby game, because it uses the same sort of “power combo” puzzles as Lego.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful visually soudtrack is stunning
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful visually soudtrack is stunning. Only problem is its so east you'll only get 6 hours from it. Co op is when this game shines.

customer_reviews.title: It was awesome I beat the game in 3 days
